compute_covar_xi module¶

compute_covar_xi.bin_avg_spherical_j0(k, rminus, rplus)[source]¶

compute the bin-averaged spherical Bessel function j0.

compute_covar_xi.cleaned_precision_matrix(cov)[source]¶

zero-out noisy modes

compute_covar_xi.clustering_covariance(k, pk_gg, bins, n_gal=0.001, R=1275.0, L_W=500.0)[source]¶

compute the integral of bessel functions over the galaxy power spectrum: (2.0 / Vol) * int (dk k**2 / 2pi**2) j0(k r_p,i) j0(k r_p,j) (P_gal(k) + 1/n_gal)**2 j0 must be bin-averaged in order to get results that aren’t nonsense. See Xu et al. 2013 (eq. 36) MNRAS 431, 2834-2860 (2013)

compute_covar_xi.clustering_signal(k, pk_gg, bins)[source]¶

compute the integral of bessel function over the galaxy power spectrum to obtain the 3d real-space correlation function.

compute_covar_xi.compute_signal_to_noise(cov, signal)[source]¶

compute the signal-to-noise for the fiducial case.

compute_covar_xi.fractional_covariance(binmin, binmax, xi_input, fractional_err)[source]¶

compute the covariance matrix for xi, assuming constant fractional sigma_ii.

compute_covar_xi.j1(x)[source]¶
compute_covar_xi.main(parameter_file, pk_gg_filename, output_clustering_filename, binfile, fractional_error=0.0)[source]¶
compute_covar_xi.measurement_bins(rmin=0.5, rmax=30.0, nbins=30)[source]¶
